stimulusHtml: A permanent bar magnet has one of its ends inside a cubical surface. Which of the following is true of magnetic field lines in this scenario?
choicesHtml: All field lines passing through the cubical surface point outward and there are none pointing inward.
The number of field lines pointing out of the cubical surface is greater than the number of field lines pointing into the cubical surface.
The number of field lines pointing out of the cubical surface is less than the number of field lines pointing into the cubical surface.
The number of field lines pointing out of the cubical surface is equal to the number of field lines pointing into the cubical surface.
